byline.contributor: Mohammed Ali Kalfood contributed reporting from Sana, Yemen, and Saeed Al-Batati from Al Mukalla, Yemen.

abstract: Human Rights Watch reports that Saudi-led military coalition has used cluster munitions supplied by United States against rebel group in Yemen; cluster munitions are banned throughout much of world but not by United States, Saudi Arabia or Yemen.
lead_paragraph: Human Rights Watch said it had found evidence that the Saudi-led coalition had used a type of munition in Yemen that is banned by much of the world because of the long-term danger it poses to civilians.

headline.main: Saudi-Led Group Said to Use Cluster Bombs in Yemen
headline.print_headline: Saudi-Led Group Said to Use Cluster Bombs in Yemen

snippet: Human Rights Watch said it had found evidence that the Saudi-led coalition had used a type of munition in Yemen that is banned by much of the world because of the long-term danger it poses to civilians.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
